description: This little village in Conwy county has some pleasant country trails and nice paths along the Afon Merddwr for walkers to enjoy. Pentrefoelas is located just a few miles east of the popular village of Betws y Coed where there are numerous walks around Snowdonia. This circular walk from Pentrefoelas explores the countryside around the village using a mixture of country lanes, bridle tracks and public footpaths. On the way there's some lovely views towards the mountains and hills of Snowdonia. You'll also pass along the Afon Merddwr which flows through the village. To continue your walking in the area head a few miles east to Alwen Reservoir where you can pick up the Alwen Reservoir Trail. Near here there's also Llyn Brenig where there are more fine waterside walks to enjoy.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Foelas Arms is an old coaching in located in the village. The inn was originally a farm which received its coaching licence in 1839, the Royal Mail coach once stopped here on its way from London through Betws-y-Coed to Holyhead. There is car parking, a garden area and good quality food served in the evenings. The inn is also dog friendly.
